Hi,

> If you only want URLs that are actually scheduled for crawling -- 
>=
 meaning they pass the in-scope test and aren't duplicates -- you could 
> =
also use the recovery log. Every line beginning "F+" is an URL being 
> que=
ued for crawling; the only duplicates will be URLs that must be 
> fetched =
more than once in a long crawl (robots, DNS, or URLs
force-added 
> by the =
operator).
 
This is good enough for me.
But i found that under $HERITRIX_H=
OME/jobs/status directory the size
of jdb files is increasing so rapidly. I=
 need only recover.gz as you
suggested. So how can i have control over jdb'=
s growing size.
